content.raw:
This doesn't work either:
~~~
In file included from /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/include/sdf/ruby.hh:26:0,
                 from /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/parser.cc:23:
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/ruby/ruby.h:24:25: fatal error: ruby/config.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.
~~~
Note that this deb installs the following files:
~~~
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/ruby/ruby.h
…
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/x86_64-linux/ruby/config.h
~~~
I think `find_path(RUBY_INCLUDE_DIRS NAMES ruby.h PATHS /usr/include/ruby-${ver_full})` won't capture that arch-dependent include folder.
content.html:
This doesn't work either:

In file included from /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/include/sdf/ruby.hh:26:0,
                 from /home/ubuntu/src/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/parser.cc:23:
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/ruby/ruby.h:24:25: fatal error: ruby/config.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.

Note that this deb installs the following files:

/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/ruby/ruby.h
…
/usr/include/ruby-1.9.1/x86_64-linux/ruby/config.h

I think find_path(RUBY_INCLUDE_DIRS NAMES ruby.h PATHS /usr/include/ruby-${ver_full}) won't capture that arch-dependent include folder.
